channel.title: Delhi NCR Events
channel.description: Upcoming events in the Delhi NCR area

item.title: PyRustLin: PyDelhi x Rust Delhi x ILUG-D Meetup
item.description:
Hey peeps,

PyDelhi is back with the June edition of our Monthly Meetups üêç. This time it's a combined one with Rust Delhi and ILUG-D.

After all üêç‚ù§Ô∏èü¶Ä‚ù§Ô∏èüêß

Please cancel your RSVP if you're not attending the meetup.

Agenda: 10:00-10:30: Introduction to PyDelhi, Rust Delhi and ILUGD 10:30-10:50: Python 1 Liners by Parampreet Singh 10:50-11:10: Secure Coding in Python by Swati Laxmi 11:10-11:40: Networking Break 11:40-12:20: Talks by RustDelhi (TBD) 12:20-12:40: LIGHTNING TALKS:

  • NetworkX's parallel backend by Aditi
  • The scientific side of Python and Open-Source by Saransh Chopra

12:40-1:20: Talks by ILUG-D (TBD) 1:20-1:30: Group Photo

The venue for this meetup is Coredge.io Office, Noida. Nearest Delhi Metro Station is Noida Electronic City (Blue Line)

RSVP link: https://www.meetup.com/pydelhi/events/300973362/ Google Maps Link: https://maps.app.goo.gl/ZEUZKA7Y6XsAF3Q6A

Contact Ishaan Arora for any help for directions on the event chat. Phone: +91 9971828563

If you have any questions please send us a message on Telegram Group or please DM us on Twitter.

Cheers, PyDelhi!

item.title: Elixir Delhi + FPIndia Combined June Meetup
item.description:
Meet and geek out about Elixir and Functional Programming in this combined Meetup with FPIndia.

Schedule for the day shall be:

- Introductions - Talk 1 by one of our esteemed Elixirists - Relax and let the compiler have your back: Non-defensive programming by Anupam Jain - Snack break - Hiring/pitching sessions - Group photo

item.title: PyDelhi May Meetup
item.description:
Hey Fellow Pythonistas,

PyDelhi is back with the May edition of our Monthly Meetups üêç. We have a few familiar and a few new speakers this time around.

Please cancel your RSVP if you're not attending the Meetup.

Agenda: 01:00 - 01:30: Introduction to PyDelhi 01:30 - 02:00: Career Options in Python by Bhupinder Kumar 02:00 - 02:30: Talk on Python Blockchain Implementation by Aditya Pratap Singh 02:30 - 03:00: Networking Break 03:00 - 04:00: Workshop on Python Blockchain Implementation by Aditya Pratap Singh 04:00 - 04:30: PyCon discussions 04:30 - 04:50: Hiring and Pitching Session 04:50 - 05:00: Group Photo

The venue for this meetup is Cluster Innovation Centre, University of Delhi Nearest Delhi Metro Station is Vishwavidyalaya (Yellow Line). E-rickshaws are generally available.

RSVP link: https://www.meetup.com/pydelhi/events/300973362/ Google Maps Link: https://maps.app.goo.gl/xVvHzVjAkzviKgDp8

Contact Siddharth for any help for directions on the event chat. Phone: +919031840522

If you have any questions please send us a message on Telegram Group or please DM us on Twitter.

Cheers, PyDelhi!

item.title: Pythonistas and Graphistas: Navigating the World of Graph Databases with Python
item.description:
Are you passionate about Python and intrigued by the fascinating realm of Graph Databases? Join us for a unique collaboration between the Graph Database Delhi/NCR User Group (powered by Neo4j) and the Python Delhi User Group on 16th March from 10 am to 2 PM for an insightful meetup that brings together the best of both worlds!

üöÄ Event Highlights:

  1. Expert Sessions: Delve into the exciting possibilities at the intersection of Python and Graph Databases with our distinguished speakers and experts in both fields.
  2. Hands-on Workshops: Gain practical experience through hands-on workshops, where you'll have the opportunity to explore the powerful synergy between Python and Graph Databases.
  3. Networking Opportunities: Connect with like-minded Pythonistas and Graphistas, expanding your professional network and fostering collaborations for future projects.
  4. Q&A Session: Engage in a dynamic question-and-answer session with our expert panel, where you can seek advice, share your experiences, and gain deeper insights into the world of Python and Graph Databases.

üóìÔ∏è Event Details:

  • Date: 16th March
  • Time: 10 am to 2 PM
  • Location: Coredge, Noida (Google Maps Location)

Speakers: üé§ Pranav Puri, Consultant @ KPMG Talk: Create your own Python Library Summary: In this talk, we will walk through how to create your own python library and what are its pros and cons. We will also talk about version control of the library. Bio: Having 6 years of working IT experience with expertise in devOps tools like GitHub Actions, Jenkins and cloud providers like AWS, Azure. 8+ years of working in Python Techstack. Hands-On experience with frameworks like Flask, ReactJS with end to end deployment.

üé§ Ishaan Arora, Backend Engineer @ Aakash BYJU's Talk: Having fun with text in Python or üêç‚ù§üî† Summary: In this talk, we'll go through the basics of what actually text is, how it's represented, and what things can be done with it in Python. Bio: I like doing Python ^^

üé§ Siddhant Agarwal, Developer Relations APAC @ Neo4j Talk: Graph powered NLP using Google Gemini, Python and Neo4j Summary: Are you ready to dive into the world of graph databases, harness the power of natural language processing (NLP), and build intelligent applications that understand and respond to human queries? Join for this exciting session to embark on a thrilling journey that combines the strength of Google Gemini, Neo4j, and Python and building intelligent Gen-AI applications. Bio: I am currently leading Developer Communities for APAC at Neo4j. Formerly, I pioneered India's first fintech community as the 'Developer Relations Lead' at Open Financial Technologies. Prior to that, I spearheaded community efforts as a Program Manager with Google's Developer Relations team in India, overseeing programs like Developer Student Clubs, TensorFlow User Groups, Google Developer Groups, and Google Developer Experts. In 2019, I collaborated with the Ministry of Electronics & Information Technology, Government of India, to launch 'Build for Digital India,' engaging 7,000+ students in solving India's challenges.

üéüÔ∏è Registration: Secure your spot by RSVP for this exclusive event. Limited seats available!

Don't miss out on this opportunity to be part of an enriching experience that blends the power of Python and Graph Databases. Whether you're a seasoned developer, a data enthusiast, or simply curious about the possibilities, this meetup is tailor-made for you!

See you there, ready to navigate the world of Graph Databases with Python like never before! üöÄüêç

#PythonistasAndGraphistas #GraphDatabases #PythonMeetup

item.title: Rust Delhi: Meetup #1
item.description:
Hi folks, Rust Delhi brings you Delhi's first Rust meetup. Join us on Saturday the 10th of June to meet fellow Rust enthusiasts, share your Rust stories and discuss the future of the Rust Delhi community. We'll accept lightning talks on the spot, if you have something you want to share!

Event Agenda (tentative):

  • Kickstarting Rust Delhi (00:10)
  • Introductions, Rust Stories and Why Rust (00:30)
  • ‚ÄúRust 101‚Äù by Guinnes Singh (00:30)
  • ‚ÄúAdventures in porting a UI framework from Haskell to Rust, part 1 - the virtual dom‚Äù by Anupam Jain (00:30)
  • ‚Äî‚Äî Networking + Food (00:30)
  • Lightning Talks. Choose to give a short talk on the spot. (00:30)
  • Hiring and Pitching. Open to anyone hiring for pula Rust role, looking for a Rust role or otherwise. (00:20)
  • Finding Our Logo with Ishaan Arora (00:20)
  • Volunteering for Rust Delhi (00:10)
